talk_09:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Princesse Zelda recent comes to sen
Mineru, the kynges elder suster. I com
eck, for hir to seruen.<sp:0:4:0>"Todai cam hit ipassen that Mineru
sheued to Zelda construct althergrettest
y hav ysen.
"Zelda, she much desired on hit to riden,
ond ne conne nat y seien coust hir
stoppen. Though I dyde protesten. Loudli.
"Neuer the lesse she made to sitten
heighe upon the constructes sculdres ond
to riden like an hors, al ful of grace.
"Min lausion, so graunt alredy, dyde
grouen al the mor."
talk0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Think_00>The stone tablet that fell from the sky is
inscribed with ancient Hyrulean.<sp:0:4:0>If I can manage to translate the text...<sp:5:1:0>
it may be key to understanding a moment
in time from ancient Hyrule.
talk0087:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Admiration_01>This inscription has tremendous
archaeological value. It's a bridge
connecting us to the distant past.<sp:0:4:0>I aim to unravel its mysteries. <sp:5:1:0>And the
sooner I get started the better.
Talk0050:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:LaughS_00>What a droll sense of humor!<sp:0:4:0>It's me, Wortsworth. The ancient-Hyrulean
scholar you met at Lookout Landing.<sp:0:4:0>Aren't you curious about my findings
here, Link?
talk0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>I can translate this from ancient Hyrulean,
but my notes are back at the research lab
in <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>So I'll be heading there to check this
text against my notes and proceed with
the translation.
talk0088:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Angry_00>If that piques your interest, Link, you
should come to <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff> so I can
share what I've translated so far.
Talk0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I thought so. <sp:5:1:0>I'm glad to see you showing
an interest in my work.
talk0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Think_00>Did you notice the number 13 there?<sp:0:4:0>That means there are <clr:0000>12<clr:ffff> more <clr:0000>stone
tablets <clr:ffff>to be found.<sp:0:4:0>If a royal chamberlain really left these...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_01>It's an interesting perspective on the
day-to-day life of the era. One which the
history books don't mention.<sp:0:4:0>There's so much we could learn here of
King Rauru, Queen Sonia, or even this
curious woman named Zelda.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Chat_01>Twelve stone tablets left... <sp:5:0:0>Fascinating.<sp:5:1:0>
Talk0052:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Hm?<sp:5:0:0> Are you interested in the text
from the stone tablet discovered at
Lookout Landing?
talk0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:QuestionSurprise_00>Link? <sp:5:1:0>I can see the excitement on your
face clear as day.<sp:5:1:0> Have you already
found something?!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>If you've tracked down a picture of a
stone tablet like the <clr:0000>one at Lookout
Landing<clr:ffff>, I'd love to see it.
Talk0054:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Are you really that interested in the text
from the stone tablet discovered at
Lookout Landing?
talk_40:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble>Where should I display this one? Maybe
on the wall over here?<sp:0:4:0>Goodness, but this place could use a
tidying up.
talk_41:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>Thanks for bearing with me.<sp:0:4:0>I put what you brought me on <clr:0000>the wall of
the research lab<clr:ffff>. You're welcome to come
and look at it whenever you'd like.
Talk0040:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you happen to find more stone tablets
on your travels, get some kind of visual
evidence of them and show it to me.<sp:0:4:0>I'll make sure there's a nice <clr:0000>reward<clr:ffff> in it
for you.
talk_42:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Understand_01>Ah! <sp:5:1:0>So King Rauru's older sister was
named Mineru.
Talk0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Speaking of which, <clr:0000>Robbie<clr:ffff> showed me
something back when he was researching
the Ring Ruins.<sp:0:4:0>He called it a "<clr:0000>camera<clr:ffff>." It would instantly
create a picture of whatever he pointed
it at.<sp:0:4:0>The pictures were so clear that it was like
looking at the real thing.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>If only I had pictures that clear of these
stone tablets I'm researching...
talk_43:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Admiration_01>I'll tell you, Link, I have never felt prouder
to be a researcher than today.<sp:0:4:0>To see all of this valuable data compiled
on <clr:0000>the research-lab wall<clr:ffff> makes me almost
overcome with emotion.
talk_44:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive>Everything you gave me is posted to <clr:0000>the<clr:ffff>
<clr:0000>research-lab wall<clr:ffff>. By all means, come and
look at it whenever you like.
Talk0044:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you bring me <clr:0000>visual evidence<clr:ffff>, there's
a <clr:0000>reward<clr:ffff> in it for you.
talk_130:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That one is all about the feats Zelda
performed for the sake of the hero.<sp:0:4:0>The details are unclear, but essentially,
the chamberlain trusted in Mineru and
Zelda's predictions and wanted to help.<sp:0:4:0>She put forth the suggestion to Mineru
to build a mechanism that could make
her stone tablets float in the sky.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Understand_00>Which I take it are the very tablets you
found, Link? <sp:5:1:0>But it doesn't end there.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>If my translation is correct, it suggests
that their Zelda worked with Mineru to
raise the Temple of Time into the sky!<sp:0:4:0>The idea of the Temple of Time—a grand
edifice built in that ancient era—being
lifted to the skies to await a hero...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_00>Although given the appearance of the sky
islands after the Upheaval, perhaps it's
not so far-fetched as it seems.<sp:0:4:0>What must it have been like for the
chamberlain to live through such
miraculous times?
Talk0046:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Understand_00>The original text of the stone tablet is
depicted here. I'll read it again for you,
so listen well.
talk_131:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This is an eyewitness account of the day
the Temple of Time floated into the sky.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Admiration_01>It's a landmark discovery for the history of
Hyrule. <sp:5:0:0>It may be one of the top 10 most
important discoveries of all time!<sp:0:4:0>Even among all the breathtaking displays
of power we knew of from the era, to raise
the land and its buildings into the sky...<sp:0:4:0>That was a feat impressive even to those
accustomed to wonders. You can tell as
much from this account.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_00>Zelda predicted that a hero would appear
in the land they raised into the sky and
that he would save Hyrule.<sp:0:4:0>The chamberlain took this on faith and
wanted to know how she could help.<sp:0:4:0>So she inscribed these records on the
stone tablets that Mineru sent into
the sky.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_01>Give me a moment. <sp:5:0:0>I need to view these
accounts as a historian and not get so
swept up in personal sentiments...
Talk0047:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This is a picture of the stone tablet that
fell from the sky at Lookout Landing.<sp:0:4:0>I managed to decipher the inscription on
it using my notes on ancient Hyrulean I
had in storage at this research lab.
talk_132:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>It seems this is the last of the records.<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>The royals whom the chamberlain served
so faithfully were gone, one by one...<sp:0:4:0>It's heartrending to read. <sp:5:0:0>Her pain comes
across so clearly in her words.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Trouble_01>What's less clear from these entries is
the cause of all these partings...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>Well, each new mystery is an opportunity
to do more research. <sp:5:0:0>If I keep digging,
someday I'll unravel it.
Talk0048:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Think_00>Here's what it says.<sp:0:4:0>"Ones held y honore als hochmayde to
kyng Rauru ond quen Sonia, thaerafter to
his suster ond to princesse Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>"Her on thaes grete stan ond twelf mo
withalle make y endite min time with the
roial familie.<sp:0:4:0>"So michte heore remembraunce
preserven for the sake of hem on whom
oure hope raeste."<sp:0:4:0><snd:Chat_01>There's not much to go on, but you can
clearly read the names of King Rauru and
Queen Sonia, the founders of Hyrule.<sp:0:4:0>The name "Zelda" is clearly legible
elsewhere in the text.<sp:0:4:0>The author finishes by saying that she
will write about the royal family's daily
lives in 13 segments.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Admiration_01>It certainly seems to be a royal diary left
behind by a chamberlain or someone of
equivalent station.<sp:0:4:0>The part that catches my attention is the
third name mentioned—Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>There's no record of anyone by that name
in any of the other texts we've unearthed
so far.<sp:0:4:0>But this is evidence that the name Zelda
is much older than the princess—it dates
all the way back to Hyrule's founding.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Happy_01>What's written here must be the start of
a firsthand account of Hyrule!<sp:5:1:0>
Talk0049:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_00>"Ones held y honore als hochmayde to
kyng Rauru ond quen Sonia, thaerafter to
his suster ond to princesse Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>"Her on thaes grete stan ond twelf mo
withalle make y endite min time with the
roial familie.<sp:0:4:0>"So michte heore remembraunce
preserven for the sake of hem on whom
oure hope raeste."<sp:0:4:0><snd:Chat_01>Not much to go on, but the author was
a servant to the founding king and queen
of Hyrule, Rauru and Sonia.<sp:0:4:0>She also attended the king's elder sister
and someone named Zelda. It's an
account of their daily lives in 13 parts.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Think_00>Which suggests that there are 12 other
stone tablets out there.<sp:0:4:0>I wonder what stories they might tell...<sp:5:1:0>
It's so exciting to think about.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Understand_00>If you find any of the remaining stone
tablets, by all means get some <clr:0000>visual
evidence<clr:ffff>, and bring it to me.<sp:0:4:0>I'll make sure there's a <clr:0000>reward <clr:ffff>for you.
talk_31:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>Thank you for bearing with me. I put what
you brought me over there.
talk_32:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_01>You're welcome to come and have a look
at <clr:0000>the research-lab wall <clr:ffff>anytime!
talk_33:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If you find any more stone tablets, please
do document them with a <clr:0000>picture <clr:ffff>so I
can see.
talk_34:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>I'll get started translating right away.
Hmm... <sp:5:1:0>Hmm...<sp:0:4:0>Oh! Yes! I see now what we have here!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_01>A firsthand historical account!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk_36:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>I knew you could do it! I'm excited to get
a look at this.
talk_38:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Very good. I thank you, not just with
words but with this as well.
talk_121:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>This is an account of a party from
those days.<sp:0:4:0>It says King Rauru and his older sister
sang and danced together while Queen
Sonia looked on.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Ease_01>We think of royalty as austere and
reserved, <sp:5:1:0>but these nobles amused
themselves with song and dance.<sp:0:4:0>But what a vivid recounting of a scene
never before related in any history book...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>The descriptions of their personalities and
expressions make the ancient past feel
alive again.<sp:0:4:0>This stone tablet is a first-class find.<sp:5:1:0>
Well done, dear chamberlain, in leaving
behind this account for us.<sp:0:4:0><snd:LaughS_01>I'm positively beside myself to think of
how this story from the ancient past
persevered so long to reach us today.
talk_39:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Thank you, Link. And I haven't forgotten
about your reward.
talk_122:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This one looks to be about Queen Sonia.
It claims that Sonia was a priestess before
marrying Rauru.<sp:0:4:0>Despite his status as a Zonai, a people
popularly thought to be gods, she would
counsel him without any trepidation.<sp:0:4:0>Moreover, Rauru heeded this counsel.<sp:0:4:0>This account gives us firsthand knowledge
of the nature of Queen Sonia and King
Rauru's relationship.<sp:0:4:0>Rauru found himself unexpectedly
charmed by her strong will, and before
long, they were married...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700>Er, that last bit isn't in the text. That's me
speculating.<sp:0:4:0>History rarely speaks of a person's
character prior to being elevated to
royalty. So I can't help but fantasize.
talk_20:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Do you have any others? This is vital
research—I want to see as many of these
stone tablets as you can show me.
talk_123:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This is a tale of King Rauru.<sp:0:4:0>Apparently, he would vacate his official
business from time to time in order to go
out hunting.<sp:0:4:0>I had the impression he was a stricter,
more serious king, but I guess he had a
lighter side as well.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Trouble_00>However, Queen Sonia was always a step
ahead. She would put a stop to King
Rauru's hunts and bring him back.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Understand_00>We rarely get a glimpse into the down-to-
earth side of royalty in this way. <sp:5:1:0>It's an
important find, to be sure.
talk_124:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The subject here is the actions King Rauru
and Queen Sonia undertook not long after
Hyrule's founding.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Trouble_00>With the kingdom established, they were
worried for their people, so they set out
to eradicate the monsters troubling them.<sp:0:4:0>They created structures called Shrines of
Light to seal the monsters away so that
they could never be revived.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500>There's more here about light...and time
too... <sp:5:1:0>The sense I get is that the two of
them may have had supernatural powers.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Understand_00>Though it's part of ancient history, it's a
feat those of us living today should still be
grateful for. <sp:5:0:0>Truly an important discovery.
talk_22:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Oh, what a significant find. Thank you so
much for showing me!<sp:0:4:0>A discovery this valuable deserves a
special place among my records. I'll hang
it up on <clr:0000>the laboratory wall<clr:ffff>!
talk_125:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>Here, we learn a bit about Mineru.<sp:0:4:0>It says that she neglected to eat or
sleep while making something called
a...construct?<sp:0:4:0>It was part of her research into a means of
returning to life as a spirit possessing a
new body, should her original one die.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think_00>To you or I, this sounds less like history
and more like some sort of ghost story.<sp:0:4:0>But remember who we're dealing with.<sp:5:0:0>
They may have had unfathomable powers
that made such things possible.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>The revelation that Mineru was a fellow
researcher makes her feel like a kindred
spirit to me, and yet...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Admiration_01>The chamberlain who inscribed these
tablets treats Mineru with such care
and kindness that it warms my heart.
talk_23:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Very good. And, as promised, I have a
reward for you.
talk_126:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This is another fascinating entry.<sp:0:4:0>If my translation is correct, the Zelda
described here is Sonia's distant relative.<sp:0:4:0>According to this, she arrived in Hyrule
unexpectedly from another kingdom.
It seems she was a beautiful princess.<sp:0:4:0>Her strange clothing perplexed the people
of Hyrule, and many were suspicious of
her at first.<sp:0:4:0>But this Zelda had such an undeniable air
of nobility that those who doubted she
was of royal birth were soon silenced.<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400><snd:LaughS_01>Note how clearly this conveys the writer's
feelings regarding Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>Once it was clear Zelda would be staying,
she applied to be chamberlain to the
princess. <sp:5:0:0>That suggests real admiration.
talk_24:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Understand_01>This is another fascinating entry.<sp:0:4:0>If my translation is correct, the Zelda
described here is Sonia's distant relative.<sp:0:4:0>According to this, she arrived in Hyrule
unexpectedly from another kingdom.
It seems she was a beautiful princess.<sp:0:4:0>Her strange clothing perplexed the people
of Hyrule, and many were suspicious of
her at first.<sp:0:4:0>But this Zelda had such an undeniable air
of nobility that those who doubted she
was of royal birth were soon silenced.<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Admiration_01>What a tale!<sp:0:4:0><snd:Happy_01>It's all so fascinating!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400>This level of detail on individual people
is virtually unheard-of in texts from so
long ago!<sp:0:4:0>I feel extremely blessed to be researching
ancient Hyrulean in such times.<sp:0:4:0><snd:LaughS_01>Note too how clearly this conveys the
writer's feelings regarding Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>Once it was clear Zelda would be staying,
she applied to be chamberlain to the
princess. <sp:5:0:0>That suggests real admiration.
talk_127:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The subject here is Zelda and Mineru.<sp:0:4:0>Zelda apparently visited Mineru often to
assist with her research.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think_00>I have no idea what kind of thing this
"construct" that allowed people to ride
on it was.<sp:0:4:0>But Zelda rode it so well that our author
the chamberlain was again impressed by
her skill at everything she tried.<sp:0:4:0>That's the long and short of it here.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>But more than the narrative, what strikes
me is the back and forth between the
chamberlain and Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>The chamberlain tried to warn Zelda of
the danger, but Zelda pushed past her
and rode the construct anyway.<sp:0:4:0>It's short but so evocative of both the
level of technology found in this era and
the character of their visitor Zelda.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Happy_01>The "treasure" found in these stone
tablets is the pearls of wisdom and
nuggets of personality contained within.
talk_25:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_01>The variety of tales on these stone tablets
continues to fascinate me.<sp:0:4:0>Zelda apparently visited Mineru often to
assist with her research.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think_00>I have no idea what kind of thing this
"construct" that allowed people to ride
on it was.<sp:0:4:0>But Zelda rode it so well that our author
the chamberlain was again impressed by
her skill at everything she tried.<sp:0:4:0>That's the long and short of it here.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>But more than the narrative, what strikes
me is the back and forth between the
chamberlain and Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>The chamberlain tried to warn Zelda of
the danger, but Zelda pushed past her
and rode the construct anyway.<sp:0:4:0>It's short but so evocative of both the
level of technology found in this era and
the character of their visitor Zelda.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Happy_01>The "treasure" found in these stone
tablets is the pearls of wisdom and
nuggets of personality contained within.
talk_128:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Here we learn something about the
fashion trends of that era.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Think_00>The story's catalyst is their Zelda telling a
tailor about the mushroom-patterned
outfits becoming popular in her homeland.<sp:0:4:0>Intrigued, the tailor fashioned some
clothing in that vein, and it caught on
in ancient Hyrule.<sp:0:4:0>Do you know Cece from Hateno Village?
Imagine the look on her face if she were
to find out!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>They say that trends go in cycles, but...<sp:5:0:0>
I didn't expect mushroom patterns to have
been in fashion so long ago!<sp:0:4:0>One last thing about the chamberlain...<sp:0:4:0><snd:Understand_00>Her interest in fashion shows there was
more to her than devoted service. She
was just like anyone else in the kingdom.
talk_26:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>How curious...<sp:0:4:0>Here we learn something about the
fashion trends of that era.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Think_00>The story's catalyst is their Zelda telling a
tailor about the mushroom-patterned
outfits becoming popular in her homeland.<sp:0:4:0>Intrigued, the tailor fashioned some
clothing in that vein, and it caught
on in ancient Hyrule.<sp:0:4:0>Do you know Cece from Hateno Village?
Imagine the look on her face if she were
to find out!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>They say that trends go in cycles, but...<sp:5:0:0>
I didn't expect mushroom patterns to have
been in fashion so long ago!<sp:0:4:0>One last thing about the chamberlain...<sp:0:4:0><snd:Understand_00>Her interest in fashion shows there was
more to her than devoted service. She
was just like anyone else in the kingdom.
talk_129:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>This one is an ancient ghost story.<sp:0:4:0>My understanding of ancient Hyrulean
isn't perfect, but I know a ghost story
when I see one.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500>It's a firsthand account of a ghostly or
maybe corpse-like woman who appeared
each night looking just like their Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>No matter the era, it seems, people can't
resist sharing a good ghost story.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Trouble_00>A bit like how there have been eyewitness
accounts of our Princess Zelda in the
newspaper, even though she's missing...<sp:0:4:0>Could our Zelda be a ghost too? <sp:5:1:0>No...
of course not.
talk_27:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_01>This one is an ancient ghost story.<sp:0:4:0>My understanding of ancient Hyrulean
isn't perfect, but I know a ghost story
when I see one.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Trouble_01>It's a firsthand account of a ghostly or
maybe corpse-like woman who appeared
each night looking just like their Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>No matter the era, it seems, people can't
resist sharing a good ghost story.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Notice_01>A bit like how there have been eyewitness
accounts of our Princess Zelda in the
newspaper, even though she's missing...<sp:0:4:0>Could our Zelda be a ghost too?! <sp:5:1:0>No...
of course not. There's no such thing!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sigh_00>As a believer in science, I should know
better than to suggest such things.<sp:5:1:0>
Please forget I said anything.
talk_110: The Strong Queen and the Receptive King
talk_28:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Swich wondrous sight y hav bihelden that
ne con hit nat justli be described.<sp:0:4:0>"The Temple of Time y sawe, ond al londe
yheld it, reisen to the skie, both ferful ond
majestatic.<sp:0:4:0>"As princesse Zelda itold mi, in fer
distaunt future comes a champioun to
that place, the hope that Hyrule safen.<sp:0:4:0>"For that champioun be hit that y thes
grete stane inscriben.<sp:0:4:0>"The kynges elder suster, Mineru, sendes
nou thes stane to the skie, that the
champioun mought hem ireden."
talk_29:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Rauru, Hyrules kyng. Sonia, hir quen.
His elder suster, Mineru. Ond eek
princesse Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>"Al whom y served, ond loved. Al whom
thurghgon. Alon kerv y thes wordes upon
this stan.<sp:0:4:0>"This stan, <clr:0000>ond al thritene<clr:ffff>, serven als roial
families recorde, min werk final, ful-wroht
for al age.<sp:0:4:0>"Mani the mark made bi thes much
biloved peples—som eth-sene, som
unsene.<sp:0:4:0>"Whan y make remembraunce of hir
markes, fele y flaume of hope, though ful
small, within mi.<sp:0:4:0>"Hit be als though thes markes som
graunt design describen.<sp:0:4:0>"I ne con nat met princesse Zelda hir lov
for hir londe. What mor than, ask y, can y
do for Hyrules peples.<sp:0:4:0>"Let min lyf lede mi fro hennes-forth an
answere ful-worthi to this questioun."
talk_10:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Facioun nou favereth garnementes
adourned with muscheron patrons, ond
fer ond wid beon thei wern.<sp:0:4:0>"This tast for mucheron com of the
casteles seamestre, who sogte to seuen
clethes for princesse Zelda to plesen.
"This facioun, Zelda telled to the
seamestre, waere in hir treu hom
wel loved.<sp:0:4:0>"In hir time werd everichon patrons of
bright hewes, in the shap of mucheron.<sp:0:4:0>"Anou our hende seamestre set herte on
thes patrons copien, which sele to mani
happi persoune.<sp:0:4:0>"Y seche after som for min one but ne
coude nat an on yfinden."
talk_11:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Of late have y herd it told a straunge ladi
walkes around the castel in derk of night.<sp:0:4:0>"She ond princesse Zelda semes als
twinnes two, but this on nadda ne light in
hir eien—mor als a ded thing than not.<sp:0:4:0>"Whan she is asked about thes walkes,
princesse Zelda of that ben no-thing
remembren.<sp:0:4:0>"What monstre, or spirit of derknesse,
be this visioun? So afeard y am of min
imagenninges that y con nat slepen."
talk_12:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Sith hire founding has Hyrule swich
hardshippe ysene, but that is onli smale
moment of time.<sp:0:4:0>"Mineru, the kynges elder suster, seyes of
this kyngdom that hit ne mot nat awaren
aye be ycaccht, nat evenforth fer futur.<sp:0:4:0>"Princesse Zelda tells hire that this futur
be wrat alredi, that a champioun bith from
the skie comen.<sp:0:4:0>"Bitwene the two, thei imaked to finden
a wei this champioun in that distaunt time
to helpen.<sp:0:4:0>"Her min treuthe, sogte thei to up-reisen
the Temple of Time, into the skie to
warden hit onyenes ivil.<sp:0:4:0>"Al dyden so in fer distaunt dai, our
kingdom mighte be safed.<sp:0:4:0>"In min herte y woot y helpen mot, ond y
asked of Mineru, canst yow devyse the
menes to upreisen in the skie thaes stane.
"Min wordes iseie nat enow, but thei
thaes memorie safen, of the roial familie,
heigh in the skie for that future time."
talk_13: <sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>Interesting... <sp:5:1:0>I'll get right to translating it.<sp:0:4:0>Oh! <sp:5:1:0>Aha... <sp:5:1:0>Incredible!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_01>It's firsthand Hyrulean history!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Huh. <sp:5:0:0>Suit yourself, I suppose. <sp:5:0:0>I'm sure
you have your reasons.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>But if you change your mind, please
come and show me a <clr:0000>picture of that
stone tablet<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>If it helps, I'm not asking you to show me
for free. <sp:5:0:0>There's a nice <clr:0000>reward <clr:ffff>in it.
talk_15:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>This is an account of a party from
those days.<sp:0:4:0>It says King Rauru and his older sister
sang and danced together while Queen
Sonia looked on.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Ease_01>It's very interesting. <sp:5:0:0>We think of royalty
as austere and reserved, <sp:5:1:0>but these nobles
amused themselves with song and dance.<sp:0:4:0>But what a vivid recounting of a scene
never before related in any history book...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>The descriptions of their personalities and
expressions make the ancient past feel
alive again.<sp:0:4:0>This stone tablet is a first-class find!<sp:5:1:0>
Well done, dear chamberlain, in leaving
behind this account for us.<sp:0:4:0><snd:LaughS_01>I'm positively beside myself to think of
how this story from the ancient past
persevered so long to reach us today.
talk_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_01>Wow. <sp:5:0:0>This one looks to be about
Queen Sonia.<sp:0:4:0>It claims that Sonia was a priestess before
marrying Rauru.<sp:0:4:0>Despite his status as a Zonai, a people
popularly thought to be gods, she would
counsel him without any trepidation.<sp:0:4:0>Moreover, Rauru heeded this counsel.<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Admiration_01>Incredible!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400>This account gives us firsthand knowledge
of the nature of Queen Sonia and King
Rauru's relationship.<sp:0:4:0>Rauru found himself unexpectedly
charmed by her strong will, and before
long, they were married...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_00>Er, that last bit isn't in the text. That's me
speculating. <sp:5:1:0>Nonetheless, this is truly
fascinating!<sp:0:4:0>History rarely speaks of a person's
character prior to being elevated to
royalty. So I can't help but fantasize.
talk_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive_01>Allow me to explain. <sp:5:1:0>It's actually a very
enlightening story.<sp:0:4:0>Apparently, King Rauru would vacate his
official business from time to time in order
to go out hunting.<sp:0:4:0>I had the impression he was a stricter,
more serious king, but I guess he had a
lighter side as well.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Trouble_00>However, Queen Sonia was always a step
ahead. She would put a stop to King
Rauru's hunts and bring him back.<sp:0:4:0>In some circumstances, you might expect
this to have been a point of tension at
their court.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>But the tone here is much more playful
than that. <sp:5:0:0>These royals were more
relatable than one might assume.<sp:0:4:0>Or so it seems from this account, at least.
How fascinating!<sp:0:4:0><snd:Understand_00>We rarely get a glimpse into the down-to-
earth side of royalty in this way. <sp:5:1:0>It's an
important find, to be sure.
talk_100:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Notice_00>Oh... Wait a moment. <sp:5:1:0>Wasn't this the
final stone tablet?
talk_18:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>I'll walk you through this one.<sp:0:4:0>The subject here is the actions King Rauru
and Queen Sonia undertook not long after
Hyrule's founding.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Trouble_00>With the kingdom established, they were
worried for their people, so they set out
to eradicate the monsters troubling them.<sp:0:4:0>They created structures called Shrines of
Light to seal the monsters away so that
they could never be revived.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500>There's more here about light...and time
too... <sp:5:1:0>The sense I get is that the two of
them may have had supernatural powers.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Understand_00>Though it's part of ancient history, it's a
feat those of us living today should still be
grateful for. <sp:5:0:0>Truly an important discovery!
talk_101:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:QuestionSurprise_00><sp:0:2:2:7d00>This is...<sp:5:1:0>unbelievable!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Ease_01>The details are unclear, but essentially,
the chamberlain trusted in Mineru and
Zelda's predictions and wanted to help.<sp:0:4:0>She put forth the suggestion to Mineru
to build a mechanism that could make
her stone tablets float in the sky.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive_01>Which I take it are the very tablets you
found, Link? <sp:5:1:0>Simply incredible.<sp:0:4:0>In finding the fantastic devices they built
to preserve these records, you fulfilled
the wishes she wrote of here.<sp:0:4:0>And it doesn't end there.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>If I'm reading this right, it suggests that
their Zelda worked with Mineru to raise
the Temple of Time into the sky!<sp:0:4:0>The idea of the Temple of Time, a grand
edifice built in that ancient era, being
lifted to the skies to await a hero...<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_01>Trust me—that's what it says!<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0>Although given the appearance of the sky
islands after the Upheaval, perhaps it's
not so far-fetched as it seems?<sp:0:4:0>There are so many revelations here...<sp:5:1:0>
My hands are trembling from all the
strange, exciting ideas!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_01>And that's from merely reading an
account long removed from the event.<sp:0:4:0>What must it have been like for the
chamberlain to live through it?
talk_19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>Here, we learn a bit about Mineru.<sp:0:4:0>It says that she neglected to eat or
sleep while making something called
a...construct?<sp:0:4:0>It was part of her research into a means of
returning to life as a spirit possessing a
new body, should her original one die.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think_00>To you or I, this sounds less like history
and more like a sort of ghost story.<sp:0:4:0>But remember who we're dealing with.<sp:5:0:0>
They may have had unfathomable powers
that made such things possible.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>The revelation that Mineru was a fellow
researcher makes her feel like a kindred
spirit to me, and yet...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Admiration_01>The chamberlain who inscribed these
stone tablets treats Mineru with such care
and kindness that it warms my heart.
talk_102:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL_00>We collected all 13 of them!<sp:0:4:0>I can't believe it!<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy_01>Finally, I've translated the whole history.<sp:5:1:0>
I'm going to need a moment.<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0>Now that I've read all of it...<sp:5:0:0>well, to step
outside my role as researcher, I'm deeply
impressed with the author.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Ease_01>I would very much have liked to meet
her.<sp:5:1:0> If only the vast gulf of time didn't
separate us!<sp:0:4:0>But of course, collecting the 13 records
on these stone tablets would have been
impossible without your cooperation, Link.<sp:0:4:0>In recognition of your work as a member—<sp:5:0:0>
well, honorary member—<sp:5:0:0>of the survey
team, I want you to have this cloth.
talk_103:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>I gained some precious understanding
from my analysis of the text discovered
this time.<sp:0:4:0>This history the chamberlain left for
posterity contains not just facts but an
important record of her feelings.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Angry_00>I want to continue my research of
ancient Hyrulean so I can convey those
feelings to the rest of the world!<sp:0:4:0>Link, thank you very much for working
with me on this!
talk_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"So swete the song of kyng Rauru, ond so
grete the beaute of his susteres daunce,
that wer min eies ond eres captif.<sp:0:4:0>"Ond so hende quen Sonias gasen on us
alle, so felt y min herte als captif fallen.<sp:0:4:0>"Seruantes lyf, tho moche laboursum,
han moche jolitee as welle. Longe be the
lyf of the roial familie thaere y love so."
talk_106:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Ease_01>The thought of such incredible historical
artifacts falling down all over Hyrule is
so exciting.
talk_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Sonia, quen to Hyrules kyng, bi birthe
Hylian preesterresse, hirself yborn of
londe, nat of skie aboven.<sp:0:4:0>"Speken she with open herte, eornest to
alle, euen even to the Zonais kyng.<sp:0:4:0>"This kyng ythinke it gode aventure so to
lerne of the londes folke. To sen his hed
ybent to listenen is swich plesaunce."
talk_107:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sigh_01>My head is spinning... <sp:5:1:0>I need to lie down.<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Admiration_01>This is an incredible find!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:6400>An eyewitness account of the Temple
of Time floating up into the sky?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Angry_00>It's a landmark discovery for the history of
Hyrule. <sp:5:0:0>It may be one of the top 10 most
important discoveries of all time!<sp:0:4:0>Even among all the breathtaking displays
of power we knew of from the era, to raise
the land and its buildings into the sky...<sp:0:4:0>That was a feat impressive even to those
accustomed to wonders. You can tell as
much from this account.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Trouble_00>Zelda predicted that a hero would appear
in the land they raised into the sky and
that he would save Hyrule.<sp:0:4:0>The chamberlain took this on faith and
wanted to know how she could help.<sp:0:4:0>So she inscribed these records on the
stone tablets that Mineru sent into
the sky.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Ease_01>Aaah! I'm so overwhelmed that the
tremors have gone past my hands
and legs. <sp:5:1:0>My whole body is shaking!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sigh_01>Please excuse me. <sp:5:1:0>This is no way for
a researcher to behave.<sp:0:4:0>I need to view these accounts as a
historian and not get so swept up in
personal sentiments...
talk0081:
<clr:0500><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:QuestionNormal_00><clr:ffff>Don't tell me. <sp:5:1:0>Based on your stature,
physique, and distinctive right arm...<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>you must be Link. <sp:5:1:0>Am I right? <sp:5:1:0>Purah has
told me so much about you.<sp:0:4:0><clr:0500><sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:ffff>I'm Wortsworth. My research specialty
is ancient Hyrulean.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:TalkPositive_01>And by ancient Hyrulean, I don't mean
the text found in the Ring Ruins but
something different.<sp:0:4:0>It's what we call the language used at the
time of Hyrule's founding. Traces of it are
still present in our speech today.<sp:0:4:0>You see the difference, I trust.
talk_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Oft wys Rauru, kyng of kene blade,
weyve his werk real in faver of the hunte.<sp:0:4:0>"Ond oft queynte Sonia, quene of kene
insight, seke out him and repaire this
kyng to kyngly besynesse.<sp:0:4:0>"In hir sapience semes she divin, that she
cunne him ever finde and for hes folly
semes him the mor humain.<sp:0:4:0>"Ond the kyng? O, he laughe. Nat him hir
equal for hir wit, he kunne. Ond the quen,
she laughe to, als even she scolden."
talk_108:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>It seems this is the last of the records.<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>The royals whom the chamberlain served
so faithfully were gone, one by one...<sp:0:4:0>It's heartrending to read. <sp:5:0:0>Her pain comes
across so clearly in her words.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Trouble_01>What's less clear from these entries is
the cause of all these partings...<sp:0:4:0>Well, each new mystery is an opportunity
to do more research! <sp:5:0:0>If I keep digging,
someday I'll unravel it.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>Like the noble chamberlain, I must do
my part!
talk0082:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>I've already copied down what's inscribed
here, so I'll be getting back to the village.
talk_06:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"The kyng was late y-come this aven, so
maked the quene to sharen tales of hir
lond, of shirines al grene yglouen.<sp:0:4:0>"Of erli daies sinnes Hyrules funding have
diverse monstres hir reaume biseged ond
assayllede.<sp:0:4:0>"Uncesinge in striffe, thei broughte to
despeir folkes lyfen. Kyng ond quen ysete
thamselue to bringen scurge to ende.<sp:0:4:0>"With might of light ond pouere, driven
abak ybeen, ond the roial couple made
thes shirines to selen hem awei.<sp:0:4:0>"Thes holi selen ben yclept Shirines
of Light.<sp:0:4:0>"Gret kyng, grete quen, y thank ye. Ye
foughte whan y wer maiden-child, that y
kude pes toknouen."
talk_07:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Queynte Mineru, the kynges elder suster,
falles so dep in hir bokes swich that she
oft foryetes to eten.<sp:0:4:0>"In min wieried wei don y what much y
con, but y fer haven that it ben litel avail.<sp:0:4:0>"Of late treteth she of 'constructes,'
thinges did she make with hir hondes as
vessel for spirit whan bodi-lich failen.<sp:0:4:0>"So, seyde she, micht she liven longe, in
spiret yhused within this 'construct.'<sp:0:4:0>"Though Mineru ne semes to holden ani
deceyte... Bi my feith, y kan nat als
trouthe thes wordes bileven."
talk0084:
<clr:0500><sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Greeting_00><clr:ffff>Ah, <sp:5:0:0>Link. You've come just in time.<sp:5:1:0> Have a
look at this.
talk_08:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Chat_01>"Ful fyn is the weder this morn, ond have
y audience with theos princes seyd ben
kin bi fer distaunt yeres to quene Sonia.<sp:0:4:0>"Bi gras has she been given a name most
swete, of Zelda she ben yclept.<sp:0:4:0>"In certain folk stered suspecioun, for
straunge wer hir garnementes ond sodein
wer her aparaunce.<sp:0:4:0>"Yet wolde hir contenonce ond bering
maked proof of hir right blod and bond to
quene Sonia.<sp:0:4:0>"Als be Zelda to remainen for a wile with
us, y wil mi-self als hochmayde offre ekein
hir servis."
